publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2582 Bill Butler: Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland)—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Scottish Executive to provide funding for the Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland) (MOJO) so that it may offer advice, assistance and support to the victims of miscarriages of justice; applauds the efforts of MOJO and its volunteer base in highlighting this gap in provision and lobbying for it to be bridged; recognises that the emotional impact on the innocent victims of miscarriages of justice can be devastating and that intensive support is necessary to help them return to society; views MOJO as a positive and imaginative initiative, and asks the Executive to continue looking at ways in which the very specific needs of those who have been wrongly imprisoned can be met in the future. Supported by: Frances Curran*, Carolyn Leckie*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Pauline McNeill*, Margaret Jamieson*

S2M-2582 Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland) (lodged on 14 March 2005) Ms Sandra White*, Mike Pringle*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Christine May*, Elaine Smith*, Jackie Baillie*, Colin Fox*, Patrick Harvie*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*, Tricia Marwick*, Fiona Hyslop*, Christine Grahame*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Cathie Craigie*

S2M-2582 Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland) (lodged on 14 March 2005) John Swinburne*, Stewart Stevenson*, Michael McMahon*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Maureen Macmillan*, Margaret Mitchell*, Shiona Baird*, Trish Godman*, Robin Harper*
S2M-2582 Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland) (lodged on 14 March 2005) Mike Watson*

S2M-2582 Bill Butler: Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland)—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by the Scottish Executive to provide funding for the Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland) (MOJO) so that it may offer advice, assistance and support to the victims of miscarriages of justice; applauds the efforts of MOJO and its volunteer base in highlighting this gap in provision and lobbying for it to be bridged; recognises that the emotional impact on the innocent victims of miscarriages of justice can be devastating and that intensive support is necessary to help them return to society; views MOJO as a positive and imaginative initiative, and asks the Executive to continue looking at ways in which the very specific needs of those who have been wrongly imprisoned can be met in the future. Supported by: Frances Curran, Carolyn Leckie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Pauline McNeill, Margaret Jamieson, Ms Sandra White, Mike Pringle, Dr Elaine Murray, Christine May, Elaine Smith, Jackie Baillie, Colin Fox, Patrick Harvie, Tommy Sheridan, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Tricia Marwick, Fiona Hyslop, Christine Grahame, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Cathie Craigie, John Swinburne, Stewart Stevenson, Michael McMahon, Mr Bruce McFee, Maureen Macmillan, Margaret Mitchell, Shiona Baird, Trish Godman, Robin Harper, Mike Watson, Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-2582 Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland) (lodged on 14 March 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*, Margo MacDonald*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2582 Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland) (lodged on 14 March 2005) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-2582 Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation ( Scotland) (lodged on 14 March 2005) Marilyn Livingstone*
S2M-2582 Executive Funding of Miscarriages of Justice Organisation (Scotland) (lodged on 14 March 2005) Cathy Peattie*
